title: 2000–01 Cupa României
text:
The 2000–01 <a href="Cupa%20Rom%C3%A2niei">Cupa României</a> was the 63rd edition of <a href="Romania">Romania</a>'s most prestigious <a href="Association%20football">football</a> <a href="Single-elimination%20tournament">cup competition</a>.
The title was won by <a href="FC%20Dinamo%20Bucure%C8%99ti">Dinamo București</a> against <a href="AFC%20Rocar%20Bucure%C8%99ti">Rocar București</a>.
Format.
The competition is an annual <a href="Single-elimination%20tournament">knockout</a> tournament.
First round proper matches are played on the ground of the lowest ranked team, then from the second round proper the matches are played on a neutral location.
If a match is drawn after 90 minutes, the game goes into <a href="Overtime%20%28sports%29">extra time</a>, where it works <a href="golden%20goal">golden goal</a> rule. If the match is still tied, the result is decided by <a href="Penalty%20shoot-out%20%28association%20football%29">penalty kicks</a>.
In the semi-finals, each tie is played as a two legs.
From the first edition, the teams from <a href="Divizia%20A">Divizia A</a> entered in competition in sixteen finals, rule which remained till today.
Semi-finals.
The matches were played on 4 April and 2 May 2001.
